name: Basic
description: The Basic ruleset contains a collection of good practices which should be followed.

name: Braces
description: The Braces ruleset contains rules regarding the use and placement of braces.

name: Clone Implementation
description: The Clone Implementation ruleset contains a collection of rules that find questionable usages of the clone() method.

name: Code Size
description: The Code Size ruleset contains rules that find problems related to code size or complexity.

name: Comments
description: Rules intended to catch errors related to code comments.

name: Controversial
description: The Controversial ruleset contains rules that, for whatever reason, are considered controversial.They are held here to allow people to include them as they see fit within their custom rulesets.

name: Design
description: The Design ruleset contains rules that flag suboptimal code implementations. Alternate approaches are suggested.

name: Empty Code
description: The Empty Code ruleset contains rules that find empty statements of any kind (empty method,empty block statement, empty try or catch block,...).

name: Finalizers
description: These rules deal with different problems that can occur with finalizers.

name: Imports
description: These rules deal with different problems that can occur with import statements.

name: J2EE
description: Rules specific to the use of J2EE implementations.

name: JavaBeans
description: The JavaBeans Ruleset catches instances of bean rules not being followed.

name: JUnit
description: These rules deal with different problems that can occur with JUnit tests.

name: Jakarta Commons Logging
description: The Jakarta Commons Logging ruleset contains a collection of rules that find questionable usages of that framework.

name: Java Logging
description: The Java Logging ruleset contains a collection of rules that find questionable usages of the logger.

name: Naming
description: The Naming Ruleset contains rules regarding preferred usage of names and identifiers.

name: Optimizations
description: These rules deal with different optimizations that generally apply to best practices.

name: Strict Exceptions
description: These rules provide some strict guidelines about throwing and catching exceptions.

name: Strings
description: These rules deal with different issues that can arise with manipulation of the String, StringBuffer, or StringBuilder instances.

name: Security
description: These rules check the security guidelines from Sun, published at http://java.sun.com/security/seccodeguide.html#gcg.

name: Type Resolution
description: These are rules which resolve java Class files for comparison, as opposed to a String.

name: Unused Code
description: The Unused Code ruleset contains rules that find unused or ineffective code.

name: Unnecessary Code
description: The Unnecessary Ruleset contains a collection of rules for unnecessary code.
